content.detailedDescription: Finished mowing the grass and was putting the riding mower in the barn when something caught my eye that was moving.  this was a round ball which had three sections with faint glowing violet/purple "windows".  imagine a ball that is divided in four sections... the top forward section, top rear and bottom rear were faintly lit.  the bottom rear section was not, and it could be seen against the light grey sky of twilight.  what actually caught my eye was more of the unusual "jaw" or "shutter" looking device that was located on the bottom front section. this "jaw" was moving up and down in a "mechanical" type of rhythum. i estimate that this object was about a half a mile away from me. it appeared to be about 50 feet above the ground and was slowly moving above the treetops. i estimate that this object could have been moving at the most about 20 mph.  my location was in the southeast corner of marion county west of acton, indiana and this object was moving east, very slightly southward toward the little town of acton. as it moved along, the "shutter" device was moving up and down and no details could be seen as far as the details or construction of either the moving jaw or the entire object.  i first thought that this object was type of ballon until i was able to focus on the shutter moving and the silloutte against the grey glowing sky of indianapolis.  at that time (1997) the southeast corner of indianapolis was being newly developed and farmland was common. the object was moving toward less populated areas to the east and tha darker regions allowed this object more clarity.  my feelings were that of "awe"... similar to my first sighting of a tornado. i finally lost sight as this object moved eastward out of sight.
content.summary: Saw purple ball with moving shutter in indiana.

content.detailedDescription: My brother and i witnessed the most amazing thing i have ever seen in my 32 years of life!!   ant 8:45 pm while coyote hunting 15 miles north of roswell, my brother said "look at the ufo!" due north was a horizontal string of lights around 10,000 ft up and around 60 miles away near ft. sumner area.  the light were very large and very bright orange.  the city lights of roswell could be seen to the south, and they were 1/6 of the size of the lights we witnessed to the north.  the lights were square/oval shaped and lit up in an easterly direction (like the front of knight riders car, best explained)this lasted around 35 seconds then disappeared.  5 minutes later a fighter jet (from kirkland?) was seen scrambling to the area and headed east around 30,000 ft.  i don't know what it was, but it was huge, and i did not believe until last night! i used to think people that came to visit roswell, and seen ufo's were idiots, not anymore.  my brother was here visiting from antlers, oklahoma, he didn't believe in this stuff, but now he does.  i'm still in shock from what i see.  i have lots of experience with aircraft, astronomy. we cant make something that large fly.
content.summary: Very large bright orange lights lighting up to the eastward like knight riders front bumper

content.detailedDescription: I spotted the same black triangle as reported by someone else over gonzales, louisiana.  i tried to film it before it left the area.  the video of the triangle isn't that great, but i caught another ufo high above and have it disappearing/cloaking/shutting down its lights  on film.  also they were in the area again on august 5th, but couldn't get anything on film.
content.summary: Black triangle ufo seen same night as other witness on mufon

content.detailedDescription:
3.5second long flash
while driving to sedona arizona southbound from flagstaff the flash appeared in front of the vehicle. after realizing it couldn't be an oncoming vehicle because the light was different, it brightened the area like a glowing beam and seemed to move south east. i asked others in the vehicle if they saw that, they confirmed, as did others in the caravan after reaching sedona. it disappeared. it just happened like anything else that day, but being a special day (occuring during the return of the ancestors gathering), it felt like a key to reality itself. i just kept driving, sober, alert, and with no increased tension.

there was another flash the next evening the 28th, 5:09pm in another part of arizona heading back to dead horse ranch from crystal peak sort of near safford. it almost seemed like it was coming from a hardware store rooftop ruffled sheet metal overhang. perhaps it was coming from the space betwixt the air itself in that direction. me and my passenger felt like it was just another run-o-the-mil otherworldly occurance that week. this was the same kind of flash but it was only two seconds and didn't seem to change direction.

each flash seemed to come from a build up of some sort, i almost got a sense that if they didn't occur i could have gotten a terrible nerve pinch in my neck and crashed the rental van.
content.summary: Near blindingly bright flash of light that didn't hurt the eye at all, compared to meteorite landing.

content.detailedDescription: I went out side because i heard some cats fighting in the front yard. it was about 11:30 p.M i saw a ball of green light toward a-mountain on the west side of town bouncing from left to right very fast as it was doing this it was moving upward and away at a  very high rate of speed fast that anything i've ever seen. after a second or two around 5 military helicopter went flying towards the object in the distance from davis-monthan air force base. living next to air force base i see all kinds of jets and other aircraft. and this was moving like nothing i've seen before
content.summary: A ball of light bounces upward then flys off seconds later helicopters chase after it

content.detailedDescription: I went out side because i heard some cats fighting in the front yard. it was about 11:30 p.M i saw a ball of green light toward a-mountain on the west side of town bouncing from left to right very fast as it was doing this it was moving upward and away at a  very high rate of speed fast that anything i've ever seen. after a second or two around 5 military helicopter went flying towards the object in the distance from davis-monthan air force base. living next to air force base i see all kinds of jets and other aircraft. and this was moving like nothing i've seen before
content.summary: A ball of light bounces upward then flys off seconds later helicopters chase after it

content.detailedDescription:
On the way to work - i work the night shift and start at 10:00pm - i was getting ready to get on the highway at 121st s and highways 75. we were starting to have heavy clouds move in as a storm front was coming in. i glanced up at the clouds and a glowing orange sphere dropped out of the clouds. the sphere then went back up into the clouds, and came back down a few seconds later. again the sphere went back up into the clouds, came down one final time, and then was gone behind the clouds.

there was lightning activity in the sky, but this was not lightning as it had a shape and was not flashing or anything, just like a glowing orange orb.

it is possible this was ball lighting - plasma - as i have never seen it before, but as this is something i can not explain i thought i would report.

thank you.
content.summary: Orange glowinging sphere in the clouds

content.detailedDescription:
My dog wanted to play fetch.So i went to the back yard with him and happened to look up and saw what i thought was a plane then as i kept looking.I noticed it had no wings it was silver.But no reflection from the sun it was not cloudy.It made no sound was expecting to hear a roar.But nothing.It was moving fast and not in a line heading n.W. veering to the left.Kinda like a missle.
1.I live at 4735 n.E. 78 pl
2.I just looked up for no reason
3.I thought it was a jet liner at frist.
4.Silver cylinder traveling like missle veering n.W.Not a straight line
5.Just coulnt come up with what it was i was looking at.Frustrated for one.But i couldnt keep my eyes off it.Kinda hurt my eyes from stairing.And i still see it in my mind
6.It disapeared into the horizon
content.summary: It had no wings.It was silver cylinder it casted no reflection from the sun.

content.detailedDescription: My 15 year old daughter first spotted some kind of "craft" she describes as having colorful (red, blue, white and yellow) blinking lights in western corner of sky (near full moon)-- she called me outside: "hurry it's going so fast!"  i arrived just in time to see it blink red and white and "zig" a dramatic upward movement before quickly disappearing behind the hill to the east of our backyard. just wondering if anyone else saw this??
content.summary: Low flying craft with blinking lights and erratic flight pattern

content.detailedDescription: I was driving south on highway 84 at or near puerto de luna. it looked to my wife and i as if it was something burning up on reentry. the first part broke into 5 or so pieces rather bright lasting around 30 seconds. the second part was a single glow that was much brighter. the altitude and angle of the object was extremely distant and high. the color was a bright orange like shade. the event occurred about a hands distance from the moon and venus to the south at about 3 o'clock visually (if you were to hold your hand about 1 foot from your eyes).
content.summary: Looked like something burning up reentering the atmosphere in 2 seperate visuals.

content.detailedDescription:
It was a few minutes before five in the morning. i stepped outside and looked up as the sky was clear and dark, not semi-cloudy as usual. i was looking at the constellations when i noticed a moving light coming from the north, and it stayed in my sight as it continued in a straight line at a high altitude across the heavens and gradually disappeared from view, toward the south. 

i immediately thought it was a satellite, as i had seen one at that time of day several years ago, and reported it, either here, or nuforc. but then while i was thinking about that, another one came right behind it, following the same path. no sound. the size appeared like a planet, maybe, and the warm color seemed more glowing than flashing. there were also a couple of meteorites, which appeared white and fell downward and disappeared. all that in the space of under five minutes. then i got tired of having my neck bent backward looking up, so i went in the house.
content.summary: Two reddish round balls flew across the sky.

content.detailedDescription:
We were standing on grayton beach at sunset watching the full mon rise and my mom asked what was in the sky, we saw 4-5 lights moving in front of distant clouds high over the ocean, at first it appeared to be airplanes/helicopters because they would sometimes make a formation but they  began to move sporadically and then multiplied into about 9 lights and also a sort of 'bobbing' orange light. as they moved across the sky they went from 4 lights to 6 to 9 then to 1 large fire ball that streaked  with trailing sparks and then they all disappeared and the fireball left a 'smoke' trail. 
we were pretty freaked out about it because there was no explanation and the movements were too fast to be planes at that distance. by the time we had sense to take a picture the lights had formed one ball and the photo shows the ball (small light right in middle of photo, taken with iphone) right before it exploded and trailed off to the left.
content.summary: Moving lights and fireball

content.detailedDescription:
My wife and i were driving on rte 173 south toward grove city, pa when we i saw a red light in the sky at the top of the hill near the intersection of george jr. rd.  i thought nothing of it as the grove city medical center (gcmc) is right up the road where they have life flight helicopters in and out frequently.
as we crested the hill and rounded the bend near gasper rd., we both noticed the red light again.  it was moving very quickly from west to east.  it slowed and then began to turn as it ascended for a banked 180 degree turn.  as it was turning, a white light appeared on the left side of the craft as if it were rotating clockwise to set itself up to speed off.  it then moved very rapidly to the west.  my wife and i lost sight of it behind the trees near the gcmc.  we both looked at each other and asked each other if we saw "it".  we both saw the same thing.
my wife says she could see the shape of the craft similar to a "stingray" as she put it, or similar to the stealth bomber.  she also thinks, but is not sure she saw a blue light on it as well.  i only saw a red light on the right side and a white light on the left side.
it moved very smoothly and quickly and i could not hear it at all.
content.summary: We saw a red light dart across the sky, turn around, rotate to show a white light , and dart in the opposite direction.

content.detailedDescription:
7-26-09 ��� 10:01 pm toni saw:  a bright white glow (like a halogen light) even with the roof line of the house.  she was in the backyard looking north walking our little dog.  object was glowing white light, looked like a dinner plate with blue lights around the edge.  moved in a south eastern direction toward a red light in the sky.
greg saw: a white light moving in a southeasterly direction.  movement was not like any know aircraft or animal or balloon.  it is more a wobble that a floating flight pattern.  shot a video.  did not like the quality decided to snap a still but forgot to turn off flash.  when the flash went off the object suddenly seemed far away and dim.  thought the reddish light was a star or mars, but as we began to study it began to ascend higher and higher into the sky until you could hardly see it.  toni and the neighbor observed flashes of light resembling lightning going to and from light.  also noticed an interruption in wireless internet at the onset of the episode
content.summary: walking our dog in the evening before bedtime

content.detailedDescription: I was taking out the trash and saw out of the corner of my eye 3 red lights in the sky. at first a thought it was a c-130 but the lights were to far apart to be an aircraft and the lights were stationary, hovering in the sky. they styed there for about 60 seconds and than the light on the left slowly faded away, than the light at the top of the triangle slowly faded away, and than the last one on the left did the same. there was no sound. i was shocked! i ran as fast as i could and told my friends.
content.summary: 3 red balls of light in triangle formation, and slowly faded away one at a time from left to right.

content.detailedDescription: I was sitting outside on a clear night, on my porch swing, talking on my phone.  i saw several orange glowing objects enter the atmosphere towards the direction of the ocean, at a high rate of speed, like falling stars, then came to an immediate halt, formed a line, as several more appeared and joined in the "formation",  then glows faded out, to be replaced by what looked like airplane lights, and each object went off i a different direction.  i was in awe and excited.
content.summary: Several orange glowing objects entered the atmosphere at a high rate of speed, then came to immediate halt, formed a line, turned into "air-plane lights" then dissapated.

content.detailedDescription: Me and two other friends went out to pickard park in indianola, ia on saturday aug. 1st at about 6 or 6:30pm, to play frisbee golf. many spectators were at the park and were awaiting a hot air balloon launch that was taking place at the balloon field neighboring the park . my friends and i started playing the course and got far enough into the course where we were seperated from the balloon spectators by alot of trees and wooded area. the balloons had not yet taken flight but our eyes were in the sky becase there was a plane flying above circling the balloon field which is about a mile away to the north east, we saw it on its southern pass aound the balloon field. i cannot remember who saw it first but i do remember that we saw one small white dot up and to the east in the very very far distance not moving. at first we thought that it might be a (very) high altitude balloon, but the more we thought about it, we came to the concultion that it was just too high up even for a plane let alone a high altitude balloon. the small white ball did not give off its own light, it was very faint and hard to keep you sight on it so we had to focus hard on it. if it had not been a clear evening it wouldn't have been seen, as we looked at it closer we noticed that there was not just one ball but three in a triangle formation. we watch the three balls for about 15 to 20 mins before we just seemed to loose sight on them. the strangest part of this all was that the balls seems to get slightly closer and further away very slowly changing the angles between the three balls but always keeping a triangle shape, as though they were all connected by somthing unseen.
content.summary: Very faint, white balls, three of them in v or triangle shape, hoverd very high

content.detailedDescription: I was working at the university of colorado colorado springs (uccs).  i was outside watching the classes change when i heard a loud explosion in the distance followed by the ricochet of the sound off the ground.  so i looked up thinking i would catch a glimpse of a jet going supersonic. but then another happened right after it.  i looked up along with the other students and saw two white lights flying from east to west.  they were basically streaks in the sky only for a few seconds as they dissappeared over the mountain range.  at first i thought it was just one of the air force bases doing some practice runs.  but i was military for 6 years years and have never heard of the air force doing supersonic runs over a city.    it seemed weird to me that there were two in such short time followed by the light anomaly.
content.summary: 2 sonic booms followed by strange lights

content.detailedDescription: I was sitting out on my back porch in boulder in the evening and looking at the stars, saw a star like light moving rapidly  moving from upper sky to lower, suddenly it took a 45 degree left turn went a little way and disappeared. immediately another exactly the same did the same on the same path.  it was too far and bright to be a star, and too accurate and with a 45 degree turn, to be human.
content.summary: Star like, but closer to earth, moved in the sky took a 45 degree left turn and disappeared, another followed on the same path

content.detailedDescription:
This report is being filed by paul ciano, field investigator #16907 on behalf of the witness. this was a separate incident which was included in the initial report, case #18056 that occured on 7/10/09. case #18056 was investigated & completed.

the witness statement is as follows: the following evening (7/11/09) at 9:30pm, i had just pulled out of my driveway and and was about 200 ft. east of my house going about 15 mph, when the same object was caught in my headlights - same size, still "ululating" like a wave w/ a tinge of the dark red color, crossing the dirt road in front of me by about 25 ft again, this time heading north towards the blm (bureau of land mgmt property) into the darkness. outside of my headlights, you could not see it. i was surprised to have seen this "thing" twice and my experience from the prior evening was validated. both times the "thing" seemed to take no notice of me and therefore did not stop or do anything other than go on its way. i've returned to the places where i saw it and saw no evidence the "thing" had adversely affected the terrain. lastly, these events occurred w/in 1 mile from each other.
content.summary: Semi-translucent 6' x 6' ululating wave

content.detailedDescription: I parked my car at the boardwalk in belmar n.J. walked up onto the boardwork to take a couple of pictures at 7:41 a.M., of the sun reflecting on the ocean, i do this all the time when i'm working at the shore. i took 3 pictures, looked at them briefly and deleted one because the sun wasn't centered in the one pic, (the first one). then got back in the car and drove to the house i was working on. about 2 hours later, i decided to look at the pics i took at that time, that's when i noticed a spot under the sun and over the horizon. i then zoomed in on the pics and relized i had caught a round object out there in the sky. i didn't see it when i shot the pics because of sun glare and the fact that i wasn't looking for anything.  the pics were shot within a few seconds of each other. you can see that object is in a different position from each pic. i feel terrible that i deleted the one! but i do have 2. after seeing the pics i knew i had something that looked very different than an airplanes reflection or a planet or a boats light or reflection. don't know what it is.
content.summary: Sphere shaped brite object above the horizon at the sea shore.

content.detailedDescription: This happened when i was 12 and playing night football with some friends at auburn lake recreational park on us103.  the ball had been mis thrown towards the hill of the lake and i went to retrieve it.  i heard a low hum getting louder as it approached. from the south 5 very bright light moved at high speed heading north.  the lights were in the pattern of a "house" shape.  we all seen it, but to this day, they deny it.  it didnt look like a plane or jet flying low.  these lights i seen all the way in the northern horizon. i didnt know what it was at first.  whatever the object was, it moved straight without stopping.  i felt dazed, but not too dazed.  i looked down at the others only to notice that they didnt move, like they had froze staring at it.  i ran up the hill.  the object didnt stop.
content.summary: Saw five large bright lights move from south to north at low altitude

content.detailedDescription:
It was almost 7:30 and i was waiting for my friends to show up so we could go egg houses. i walked outside on my front porch and looked out toward the local mountain ranges. to my suprise i saw something, at first i was taken back by it, i was always a believer in ufo's but i never thought i would see one myself. it was a large, elongated triangle, with lights on the bottom. it blacked out the sky behind it. at first it was just slowly moving, hovering over the mountains. i went inside to try and find a camera and tell someone, my camera had dead batteries and no one ever believed me. when i came back outside, the ufo had turned almost completely vertical toward the sky, i went back inside to tell my father, since he just got out of the shower and was the only one who could possibly believe me. but when i went to show him, it was gone.

i've included a sketch, of when it turned toward the sky.
content.summary: On halloween night when i was a teenager i walked outside and saw a triangular ufo in the sky

content.detailedDescription: At about 9 pm i went outside to get the animals food and bring it in for the night. i was at the picnic table which is at the northern end of our patio and looked towards the tower. above said tower, i saw a series of bright lights (5) that looked out of place. i was thinking it was an airmed helo, or an army helo, but no sound, not even crickets. it started to move towards the west (gonzales) and that is when i notice two more behind it. the other two stopped above the tower for a few minutes and then they started to fly towards the west.
content.summary: Black triangle object seen above laurel ridge radio tower

content.detailedDescription: I walked out back door of my house, saw 2 objects which at first i thought were airplanes or helicopters. however, they danced back & forth and up & down like gigantic fireflies about 3 to 5 miles west of my house, heading west along the foothills of the san gabriel mountains, making no sounds. they flew back & forth, up & down like fireflies - no man made objects could maneuver like that. my 11 year old daughter, 26 year old step daughter and my wife also watched them for 10 minutes until they appeared to descend against the side of the foothills and the lights were gone. none of us have ever seen anything like it. they definitely were aircraft sized lights. it was too dark to take a photo.
content.summary: 2 bright lights alternating blue/green to red dancing like fireflies w/no sound

content.detailedDescription: My 21 year old daughter asked if she was seeing a plane. i got up and grabbed the camera as i went. i looked up and saw it as it went over our house! it was heading south, a round red light that flashed a small white light near the bottom. it was moving slower than a plane, even in the dark sky we could see it was round. it curved in the sky, and i ran out to our backyard but it was hugging the treeline and made a photo impossible. i saw it heading back toward the north before i could no longer see it. took three photos but they show nothing viewable. i will save them and send them in if requested. two people witnessed this event.
content.summary: Red, silent orb with single flashing light curved from north and went in an arc back to the north

content.detailedDescription:
I stepped outside of my home at 10:30 pm to do some sky gazing for a while prior to turning in for the night.  my purpose was to observe the stars and look for orbiting satellites and meteors.

it was a cloudless, clear night. visibility was unlimited.  there was some background light from the town of grand blanc, mi and floodlights associated with the buick open festivities beamed about the sky.  stars, the moon, and normal air traffic were clearly visible.

shortly after i began sky gazing, i observed one meteor make a short streak in the sky directly above my location.  the meteor was traveling from west to east.  at approximately 10:50 pm. i observed what initially appeared to be another meteor traveling from west to east along a latitude well north of grand blanc, mi. i observed the first streak of light from the apparent meteor and expected not to see another streak due to the meteor having burned up in the atmosphere or skipped back into space.  shortly after the light from the meteor abruptly extinguished, a streak appeared again along the same heading as the first streak and appeared to be roughly the same length.  my subsequent thought was that the meteor had made two skips in the atmosphere and had burned out after he second skip.  when i saw a third streak of light similar to the first two along the same course as the first two i initiated a count (one-one thousand, two-one thousand) and determined that the subsequent streaks of light appeared at approximately two second intervals and had durations of approximately one-half second each. after the fourth or fifth skip, the apparent meteor made a rapid course change from west to east to south/southwest to north/northeast.  the course change was made while the apparent meteor was in contact with the atmosphere as the streak traced out a curve from the previous course to the new course. the meteor then appeared to skip two more times along its new north/northeast heading before its view was blocked by trees in the line of sight of the object.  the meteor appeared to maintain steady course and speed along its two headings.  the duration of this first observation was approximately 30 to 45 seconds.

excited about the behavior of the apparent meteor, hereafter referred to as the object, i immediately went inside of my house to tell my wife and one of my sons (the other was out with friends) about the object i had just observed.  my wife had been asleep on the couch and i woke her up to tell her about the object.  i also called down to my son who was in the basement either watching tv or on the pc or internet to tell him about the object.  both my wife and my son expressed interest in what i had observed, made a couple of joking remarks, and chose to remain in the house after i asked them to come out with me to watch the sky in the event the object was in orbit and could come back again.  i expected to see the object in approximately 90 minutes traveling from sse to nne if it was an orbiting object and if its course did not change again.

i went back outside to continue sky gazing and to wait for the object to fly by again in 90 or so minutes.  i placed a call on my cellphone at 11:07 pm (the call is logged on my cellphone) to my parents' in virginia to tell them, particularly my father who also is a regular sky gazer, about the object i had just observed and its behavior.  my father was asleep on the patio according to my mother so i told her not to wake him.  i told my mother about the object i had just observed and its behavior, and explained to her that i was going to watch for another 90 minutes or so to see if the object was going to fly by my location again.  shortly after the call began, i observed what seemed to be another object traveling from west to east with the apparent light lengths, intensity, durations, altitude, and skipping intervals as the first object i had observed.  the object was traveling along a latitude that was farther south of the first object's latitude and passed almost directly over my position.  the object made approximately four skips and made a rapid course change from it's east to west heading to a sse to nne heading.  the course change was madewhile the object was in contact with the atmosphere as the streak traced out a curve from the previous course to the new course just like the first object i had observed earlier.  the object skipped a couple more times and was observable until its view from my position was blocked by trees along the travel and line of sight of the object.

excited that i observed the same type of object within approximately 20 minutes of the first object traveling in the same direction and making a similar course change as the first object, i continued to excitedly tell my mother over the cellphone about the second object and at the same time hurried into my home to tell my wife and son about the object and get them to come outside with me to look for more objects.  my wife stated that she was too sleepy and did not want to go outside to look for more objects.  i called down to my son in the basement and persuaded him to come outside to look for the same or other object and to witness any subsequent object with me as i didn't think anyone would believe that i observed these objects alone.  my son and i went outside to watch the sky in the event the same objects or other similar objects fly by or over again.  we watched the entire sky but expected subsequent objects to be traveling from west to east at anytime between 20 minutes and 90 minutes.  within approximately 15 minutes of going outdoors to watch for the same or similar apparently orbital objects, i was facing west when i observed what appeared to be a similar object traveling from north to south at an azimuth angle just above a line of trees near our position.  the object appeared to exhibit similar light lengths, intensity, durations, altitude, and skipping intervals as the first and second objects i had observed.  i observed the third object for approximately 15 seconds.  upon sighting the third objected, i immediately alerted my son to its position and line of travel by pointing and telling him loudly where to look.  my son picked up the object visually and watched it with me until the object made a rapid course change from north to south to nne to sse and immediately disappeared from both our sights behind the trees west of our position.  my son acknowledged that he did see the third object although he saw it for a shorter duration (approximately 10 seconds) than i did.

my son and i waited outside for a while longer to wait to observe any subsequent object or objects similar to the prior objects that might fly by or over our position.  my son went back inside the house after 15 minutes or waiting.  i continued to speak with my mother by cellphone and watch for similar orbiting / skipping objects.  after many more minutes, i did not observe any other orbital / skipping objects similar to the prior three objects, nor did i observe any other objects, to include meteors, other than the stars, the moon, the festive flood lights roaming the sky, and normal air traffic.  i concluded sky gazing and my cellphone call with my mother at approximately 12:15 am on august 1, 2009.  i went back into my home to speak to my wife and son about what my son and i had observed.  i went to bed at 12:22 am on august 1, 2009.

i am reporting the object or objects i and my son observed on july 31, 2009 as a ufo or ufos as neither i nor my son were able to identify what the object or objects were based on our visual observations and our knowledge and previous observations of flying and orbital objects such as aircraft, meteors, comets, satellites, and manned spacecraft.  i am hopeful that as we sighted these objects on three separate occasions on a cloudless and clear night, that others who might have seen the same objects that same night have filed or will file a report of their observations of the objects as well.
content.summary: Atmosphere skipping object(s) under apparent deliberate control

content.detailedDescription:
Upon returning from a movie in lancaster, pa on friday, july 31 at around 11:30pm est, i was taking my dog out when i was attracted to a bright, star-like object to the southeast. there were other stars in the sky and this was much larger and brighter than any star in the sky (it looked approximately 5-10 times the size of the closest star), and it was much closer and lower in the sky than a star would  be. i watched it for approximately 10 minutes during which time it did not appear to move. it was not an airplane or helicopter. i also observed a very small blinking light moving in the sky from east to west. i watched the blinking light move very slowly directly at the white light and then past it continuing to the west. the light flashed blue and red at a rapid pace. these did not blink at the same pace as traditional aircraft lights. i was very curious and confused but i took my dog inside and shrugged it off. 
i did not look on saturday night, august 1, but on sunday, august 2 between 10-10:30 pm i saw the same light in the same location. when i had gotten home around 10 i had specifically looked in the same direction and had not seen anything. i observed that it was very cloudy and not one star could be seen in the sky. i came out 2 minutes later with my dog and it was there again in the same location! it was the same size and brightness as before. again, i observed it for about 10 minutes and it did not appear to move. i showed my brother and he agreed it was not a star and not an airplane or helicopter. i was a little freaked out so i went inside. i checked it again about 15 minutes later and it was gone. 
on monday, august 2, i again witnessed the same object at the same approximate time between 10-10:30. this time it was in the same approximate direction but lower and further to the east. it was right above the neighbors tree line in the far distance. this night i showed 2 other members of my family as well as my girlfriend. no one could explain what they were seeing. on this night my younger brother, girlfriend and i also witnessed the same blue and red flashing lights. this time there were two and they both moved slowly through the sky in different directions. at one point one of them passed directly over our heads and we could not identify the object. it is very hard to estimate how high these objects were. we watched the star-like object for about 15 minutes and it did not move at all. we all went inside but checked it about every 10 minutes for the next 30 minutes. every time we checked it after being inside the light had moved higher in the sky. each time it had moved clockwise, notably higher in the sky like an arc. when we would go out to check it never appeared to move, it would always appear fixed in the sky. 
the next night, tuesday, august 4, i got home around 10 pm from a night class. as i drove up i looked but did not see the light. however, upon parking the car and walking to the front door i noticed that it was indeed there. it was in the same spot as monday night. i again showed my mother and younger brother and they agreed it was very odd. we again saw the same blinking blue and red light moving from the east to the west. my mother could not explain what it could be. i viewed it through binoculars and it just appeared to be a bright, ball of light. i tried to record it with a digital camera but could not get a could look at it. my brother and i followed the same routine of checking it every 10 minutes and it again moved in the same pattern as monday, clockwise in a high arc. the change in location were very noticeable, yet when we watched it always appeared to be fixed. after about 30 minutes it was gone again. this is all very strange and it is freaking me out because it appears to show up just as i return from being somewhere. it only moves when i am not watching and it always disappears when i am not watching. i would like someone in the lancaster area to get a telescope on this thing to try and identify it. i am contacting mufon so they can identify this thing and get me some answers. if you are in the lancaster area check the sky around 10-11 pm. tonight august 4 the moon was very visible and it appeared to be to the east of the moon and lower in the sky. this star-like object is definitely not a tower of any kind as it moves in the sky. it is also not a conventional aircraft or a star (again because it moves and disappears and is much larger and brighter than any star).
content.summary: Star shaped object seen starting july 31, also seen august 2, 3 and 4 at same location and same approximate time.

content.detailedDescription:
At 12:52 am 08/03/09 est i viewed (with my opticam 1050) a star sized orb changing colors: red to green to yellow/white located wsw ~ 45 deg elev.  i called my two daughters to view and confirm this sighting.  next my wife viewed this multi-colored orb through the opticam 1050 and concurred on the color changes compared to saturn in the eastern sky.  
at ~ 1:03 am we sighted a second smaller star sized orb located n ~ 45 deg also changing colors in sync from red to green to yellow/white as the first orb.  the sky was clear as we marked the time at 1:13, 1:22, and 1:30 am.  the orbs maintained their general positions while dropping their elevation ~ 10 deg. within the 42 minutes of observation.
content.summary: Four people saw two stationary orbs (wsw and n) changing color in synch from red to green to yellow/white at a 45 deg elevation.

content.detailedDescription: I went out skywatching taking my night-vision binoculars and digital camera which i've done only 6-7 times lately. i sat watching maybe 30 minutes after seeing a couple falling stars and a plane when i spotted a brighter object out of the nw headed somewhat towards me going se. i first looked at it through my night-vision binoculars, but i didn't notice strobe lights. i then got my video recorder ready and started filming. i could not see anything in the lcd lens so i just pointed in the direction it was and hoped i was catching this just in case. the object made no sound whatsoever. the object was almost past me when it did some pulsating or something and disappeared, but i want to call it "flickering out." the object stayed in a straight line with plane-like speed. i did manage to catch some video but the quality isn't great cause it's shaky and i played the video to my tv and recorded that with my iphone so it's a video of a video. i did upload the video to youtube.Com from my iphone and if you search (possible ufo near victoria,tx) or search my username (joshtx1) you should find it. i do have the original video that i need to upload to the computer but i have to upgrade and pay for nerophoto if that's what it's called. this is a correction from the last almost identical report. in the last report i typed that someone else saw a similar object on the same night as me but it turns out it was 6-26-09 not 7-26-09 and 11:50pm. after this i am going to look up reports again but with the right date...
content.summary: Bright object near victoria, tx. video on youtube. correction of original report
